existing_custody_order.reasoning: Complaint pleads an existing order entered June 15, 2021 awarding primary physical custody to Plaintiff and defining Defendant's visitation (every Wednesday overnight and every other weekend) (see ¶¶ 3.1, 1.3).

specific_modification_sought.reasoning: Complaint specifically requests elimination of the Wednesday midweek overnight visitation and adjustment of the alternate-weekend schedule to a distance-appropriate plan (see ¶¶ 4.1, 7.2–7.3 and prayer ¶¶ 9.2).

material_substantial_change.reasoning: Complaint alleges a concrete, unanticipated change since the prior order: Defendant's relocation to New Hampshire (¶ 5.1) and his intent to keep the same schedule (¶ 5.2), resulting in ~90-minute one-way drives (¶ 5.3) that cause school-night travel, missed/late school and loss of after-school activities, and observable anxiety in Sophie (¶¶ 5.4–5.5). These facts are pleaded as a substantial and material change affecting Sophie’s welfare (¶¶ 5.6).

best_interests_of_child.reasoning: Complaint alleges that the requested modification is necessary to protect Sophie’s best interests by preventing educational disruption, preserving participation in after-school activities, and protecting her emotional stability (¶¶ 6.1–6.3), and ties those legal assertions to specific factual harms (long travel time, school absences/tardiness, reduced activity participation, and observed anxiety) (¶¶ 5.3–5.5).
